paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted BRCA2 variant information and penetrance data from the study.

functional_data.summary: The BRCA2 6503 delTT mutation is a recognized founder mutation, distributed throughout Europe and the USA.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, it segregates with disease in families.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on multiple family cases.
variants.additional_notes: This mutation is particularly frequent among families attending the Aberdeen and Dundee clinics.
key_quotes: The BRCA2 6503 delTT mutation is relatively frequent among families attending the Aberdeen and Dundee clinics.

functional_data.summary: This variant is believed to affect splicing.

variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on its effect on splicing.
variants.additional_notes: Details on affected individuals are not provided.

tables_processed.table_caption: Breast and ovarian cancers recorded in BRCA1 and BRCA2 mutation-bearing families

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant BRCA2 variants were extracted, with a focus on penetrance data.
